steps.content: The abbreviation â€œS4Sâ€ stands for â€œShoutout for Shoutout.â€ On Instagram, â€œS4Sâ€ is a popular way to grow your account. Two users agree to give each other a â€œshoutout,â€ or a photo (or video) of the other personâ€™s account that encourages their followers to follow them. If both users have highly engaged followers, itâ€™s an effective strategy to boost their exposure and gain followers quickly. [1] X Research source People usually put their email address in their Instagram profile so other users can contact them for shoutout. Otherwise, they discuss the details via direct message or through the â€œContactâ€ button at the top of their profile. Sometimes, users will only agree to shoutout another account if they have a similar number of followers. For example, a popular account with 25,000 followers might put â€œS4S 25k+â€ to let others know that they only accept requests from those that have at least 25,000 followers.

steps.title: Find an account you want to promote yourself on.
steps.content: Find an account you want to promote yourself on. â€œS4Sâ€ works best if both accounts have a similar brand or aesthetic. So, look for accounts that post similar content as you and have a similar number of followers. If you have 10,000 followers, youâ€™re more likely to get a response if you request a shoutout from users that have between 9,000-12,000 followers. [2] X Research source Know your audience. Users that already follow a fitness account, for instance, are more likely to follow you if you post workout-related content (rather than food or fashion).

steps.content: Contact the account owner via email, DM, or the â€œContactâ€ button. Once you find an account you want to promote yourself on, message the owner and ask them if theyâ€™d be interested in a â€œS4S.â€ You might want to send them a photo or video that they can use, along with a description of what they can say to promote you. That way, they donâ€™t have to do any work besides post your content. [3] X Research source For example, you could message someone and say, â€œHey! I just stumbled upon your account, and I noticed we have a similar theme and a similar number of followers. Would you be interested in a S4S to grow your account?â€

steps.content: Promote the other personâ€™s account on your Instagram page. Oftentimes, people post a shoutout on their story, but you can also upload a normal photo or video to promote their page on your profile. [4] X Research source For example, you could post a photo of their page with the text â€œShoutout to @bananabreadlover! Itâ€™s essentially cross-promoting someoneâ€™s page to gain more followers and traffic, similar to the â€œShoutout for Shoutoutâ€ strategy on Instagram. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Support for Support
steps.content: Support for Support Back when Myspace was super popular, the abbreviation â€œS4Sâ€ stood for â€œSupport for Support.â€ Two sites would swap codes with each other and paste it into their bulletins so their friends could add them. Simply put, it was another way to gain more friends.

steps.content: Subscribe for Subscribe On Youtube, the abbreviation â€œS4Sâ€ means 2 channels agree to subscribe to each other. It usually happens when someone comments â€œS4Sâ€ on another personâ€™s video, so itâ€™s a quick and easy way to increase their subscriber count . [6] X Research source

steps.content: Stud for Stud In relationships, â€œS4Sâ€ refers to a relationship between 2 black Studs, or lesbians who present themselves as more masculine. They may also refer to themselves as Butch. [8] X Research source
